flawed_nl_solution:
Susan picked 3 times as much as 36 which is 3*36 = <<3*36=108>>108 apples
She gave out half which is 108*(1/2) = <<108*(1/2)=54>>54 apples
She now has 108-54 = <<108-54=54>>54 apples
Frank sold a third of 36 which is 36*(1/3) = <<36*(1/3)=108/1>>108/1 apples
Frank now has 36-108/1 = <<36-108/1=-72>>-72 apples
Altogether they now have 54+-72 = <<54+-72=-18>>-18 apples
#### -18

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 108/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
